children.name: distanceX
children.title: Distance X
children.tooltip: Distance, in blocks, that the layer should move horizontally. Positive numbers mean right, negative numbers mean left.

children.name: distanceY
children.title: Distance Y
children.tooltip: Distance, in blocks, that the layer should move vertically. Positive numbers mean down, negative numbers mean up.

children.name: movementDuration
children.title: Movement Duration
children.tooltip: How long, in seconds, it takes for the layer to move from one end of the line to the other.

children.name: waitDuration
children.title: Wait Duration
children.tooltip: How long, in seconds, the layer waits before beginning another movement.

children.name: mode
children.title: Timing Mode
children.tooltip: Controls what type of timer the layer uses for its movement. A global timer counts up for the entire level and will keep layers in-sync with one another. A local timer is specific to this controller and only counts up when it is active. This setting has no effect for controllers activated by events.

children.name: pauseDuringForcedState
children.title:
Pause During
Forced States
children.tooltip: If ticked, the layer's movement will stop whenever a player is in a "forced state" (e.g. taking damage, powering up, etc).

children.name: func
children.title: Function
children.tooltip: Which type of easing function to use when the layer starts/stops moving. "None" will result in linear movement.

children.text: You can view some different easing functions at easings.net.

layout.name: activationMode
layout.title: Activation Mode
layout.tooltip:
How and when the layer is active.
Always Active: The layer is permanently moving.
Active within Range: The layer only moves while the player is within a certain range. Good for performance.
Activated by Event: The layer will only move after a certain event has been triggered.

children.name: activationMargin
children.title: Activation Margin
children.tooltip: Additional space around the controller within which it should be active. If set to 0, the layer only moves while the controller is on screen.

children.name: activationEventName
children.title: Event Name
children.tooltip: The name of the event that should activate the controller.

children.name: eventActivationMoveCount
children.title: Move Times
children.tooltip: How many times the layer should move as a result of the event being triggered.

layout.name: debug
layout.title: Debug
layout.tooltip: Displays extra visuals to demonstrate how the layer moves. Only displays while testing in the editor.
